subject: Re: Does a new member start posting by emailing or can one use the Post function
msgSnippet: Both will work, as you see. Unfortunately, it is necessary to moderate these groups due to the amount of spam our members would otherwise have to deal with. As
messageBody:
Both will work, as you see. Unfortunately, it is necessary to
moderate these groups due to the amount of spam our members would
otherwise have to deal with.

As a moderator, I welcome your submissions and will gladly approve
on-topic messages as soon as I see them.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Cossy Rosario
<cossyrosario@y...> wrote:
>
> Dear Moderators,
>
> I have posted two messages using the Post function,
> and, since they haven't appeared as yet, and I know
> that new members' first posts need moderator approval,
> I don't know whether they are awaiting approval or
> whether they were discarded as they were not sent by
> email.
>
> I don't have a copy of those posts, as I expected to
> see them on the group page at some time.
>
> If they don't appear there in a reasonable time, I
> will re-write them and post by email.
>
> Can I post from the group page? I've set my member
> settings to No Email to avoid getting my email box
> flooded by the many groups I'm on. So I read messages
> on the group site, and would find it easier to post
> directly from the Post function.
>
> Yours sincerely,
> Cossy
>
>
>
> __________________________________
> Do you Yahoo!?
> The all-new My Yahoo! - What will yours do?
> http://my.yahoo.com

   Both will work, as you see. Unfortunately, it is necessary to
moderate these groups due to the amount of spam our members would
otherwise have to deal with.

   As a moderator, I welcome your submissions and will gladly approve
on-topic messages as soon as I see them.
